verses.text: And he began again to teach by the sea side: and there was gathered unto him a great multitude, so that he entered into a ship, and sat in the sea; and the whole multitude was by the sea on the land.
And he taught them many things by parables, and said unto them in his doctrine,
"JESUS_START" Hearken; Behold, there went out a sower to sow: "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" And it came to pass, as he sowed, some fell by the way side, and the fowls of the air came and devoured it up. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" And some fell on stony ground, where it had not much earth; and immediately it sprang up, because it had no depth of earth: "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" But when the sun was up, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" And some fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, and it yielded no fruit. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" And other fell on good ground, and did yield fruit that sprang up and increased; and brought forth, some thirty, and some sixty, and some an hundred. "JESUS_END"
And he said unto them, "JESUS_START" He that hath ears to hear, let him hear. "JESUS_END"
And when he was alone, they that were about him with the twelve asked of him the parable.
And he said unto them, "JESUS_START" Unto you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God: but unto them that are without, all these things are done in parables: "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" That seeing they may see, and not perceive; and hearing they may hear, and not understand; lest at any time they should be converted, and their sins should be forgiven them. "JESUS_END"
And he said unto them, "JESUS_START" Know ye not this parable? and how then will ye know all parables? "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" The sower soweth the word. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" And these are they by the way side, where the word is sown; but when they have heard, Satan cometh immediately, and taketh away the word that was sown in their hearts. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" And these are they likewise which are sown on stony ground; who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with gladness; "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" And have no root in themselves, and so endure but for a time: afterward, when affliction or persecution ariseth for the word's sake, immediately they are offended. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" And these are they which are sown among thorns; such as hear the word, "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" And the cares of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things entering in, choke the word, and it becometh unfruitful. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" And these are they which are sown on good ground; such as hear the word, and receive it, and bring forth fruit, some thirtyfold, some sixty, and some an hundred. "JESUS_END"
And he said unto them, "JESUS_START" Is a candle brought to be put under a bushel, or under a bed? and not to be set on a candlestick? "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" For there is nothing hid, which shall not be manifested; neither was any thing kept secret, but that it should come abroad. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" If any man have ears to hear, let him hear. "JESUS_END"
And he said unto them, "JESUS_START" Take heed what ye hear: with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you: and unto you that hear shall more be given. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" For he that hath, to him shall be given: and he that hath not, from him shall be taken even that which he hath. "JESUS_END"
And he said, "JESUS_START" So is the kingdom of God, as if a man should cast seed into the ground; "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" And should sleep, and rise night and day, and the seed should spring and grow up, he knoweth not how. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" For the earth bringeth forth fruit of herself; first the blade, then the ear, after that the full corn in the ear. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" But when the fruit is brought forth, immediately he putteth in the sickle, because the harvest is come. "JESUS_END"
And he said, "JESUS_START" Whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of God? or with what comparison shall we compare it? "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" It is like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown in the earth, is less than all the seeds that be in the earth: "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" But when it is sown, it groweth up, and becometh greater than all herbs, and shooteth out great branches; so that the fowls of the air may lodge under the shadow of it. "JESUS_END"
And with many such parables spake he the word unto them, as they were able to hear it.
But without a parable spake he not unto them: and when they were alone, he expounded all things to his disciples.
And the same day, when the even was come, he saith unto them, "JESUS_START" Let us pass over unto the other side. "JESUS_END"
And when they had sent away the multitude, they took him even as he was in the ship. And there were also with him other little ships.
And there arose a great storm of wind, and the waves beat into the ship, so that it was now full.
And he was in the hinder part of the ship, asleep on a pillow: and they awake him, and say unto him, Master, carest thou not that we perish?
And he arose, and rebuked the wind, and said unto the sea, "JESUS_START" Peace, be still. "JESUS_END" And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.
And he said unto them, "JESUS_START" Why are ye so fearful? how is it that ye have no faith? "JESUS_END"
And they feared exceedingly, and said one to another, What manner of man is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?
